proposals.job_title: Gaming AI Expert Needed for Robotics-Integrated Product (Profit-Share Opportunity)
proposals.description:
We're looking for a Gaming AI expert to help integrate our Minimum Viable Product (MVP) with advanced robotics — pushing the boundaries of AI-driven interactive experiences.

This opportunity is ideal for someone who is not only technically skilled but also visionary. We're offering profit-sharing post-launch and potential co-founder status for the right candidate.

🚀 Project Overview:

We're developing an innovative platform that blends gaming agents with robotics embodiment, allowing real-worl...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

The "integration challenges" you mentioned really resonated with me. I recently helped a small startup trying to merge a sophisticated pathfinding AI with a physical drone, and the disconnect between the simulated world and the real one was a massive hurdle. We ended up having to build a custom calibration layer to account for real-world physics.

For your project, I'd suggest initially focusing on small-scale simulations with the robotics component, mapping out the discrepancies. Then, iteratively refining the AI agent's behavior based on real-world feedback. Finally, we could look at building a dynamic adjustment system to handle unforeseen circumstances.

I'm intrigued by the profit-sharing model, and would genuinely love to chat more about your vision and how my background might align. Are you free for a quick call sometime next week?

proposals.job_title: CRM-Driven Digital Business Card Platform with NFC Integration
proposals.description:
Project Summary:
We are seeking a skilled developer or small development team to build a lightweight SaaS platform that combines the core features of digital business card systems like Kado (https://www.kadonetworks.com) and V1CE (https://v1ce.co), but with a dedicated focus on lead capture, CRM functionality, and post-event follow-up tailored to trade show and event environments.

Objective:
Create a modular, scalable MVP platform where users can:

Generate and manage digital business cards (NF...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Reading about your "automation needs" for the CRM-driven digital business card platform resonated with me. I've seen firsthand how manually wrangling leads after a trade show can kill momentum, and I once spent a week untangling a competitor's messy post-event email sequence for a client – a total nightmare.

To tackle this, I'd initially focus on: 1) building a robust NFC-integrated digital card generator linked directly to your CRM. 2) then, implement automated follow-up sequences based on lead categorization from the event. 3) Finally, develop a user-friendly dashboard for managing leads and analyzing campaign performance.

This all seems really exciting, and I'd love to chat more about your vision. Let me know if you're free for a quick call sometime next week.

proposals.job_title: QuickBooks specialist needed to set up QuickBooks for a small business
proposals.description:
We are a growing business with multiple product lines and clients, and we’re looking for a skilled QuickBooks expert to help us set up and customize our account from scratch. Our goal is to streamline our financial tracking, inventory management, and reporting so we can better understand our profitability and cash flow.

What We Need:

Full setup and customization of QuickBooks Online or Desktop
Integration with our business bank accounts
Set up chart of accounts, categories, and rules for autom...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

"Streamline our financial tracking, inventory management, and reporting" – I totally get that. I remember helping a local bakery owner who was drowning in spreadsheets before she finally switched to QuickBooks. Seeing her reclaim her weekends was pretty rewarding.

For your business, I'd suggest starting with a solid chart of accounts built around your multiple product lines. Then, we could tackle those bank integrations and set up some smart rules to automate as much of the categorization as possible. Finally, we can look at reporting to clearly visualize your profitability.

Would be happy to hop on a quick call to chat about your specific needs and how I can help.

proposals.job_title: Web App Developer / No-Code Integrator for Conscious Tech Platform (Ongoing Role)
proposals.description:
I'm building a purpose-driven platform called the Empowerment Quest, which blends personal growth, community support, and non-monetary exchange into a unique, role-based web app. The system uses a custom framework (TRI: Time, Responsibility, Investment) alongside reflection loops (GROW: Goals, Resistance, Outcomes, Ways), and integrates gamification, AI (eventually), and an internal rewards system called eSynergy.

✅ What I need help building right now (Phase 1 – MVP):

A course-based experience...
proposals.message:
"Hi there! 'Integration challenges' - that really jumped out at me. I’ve been there. I remember wrestling with a complex CRM system for a non-profit, and it felt like every new integration brought three new problems. It taught me the importance of starting with a rock-solid architecture.

For your Empowerment Quest, tackling those integration hurdles for your course-based experience could look like this: First, a deep dive into the TRI framework and how that needs to translate technically. Then, a phased build, focusing on *one* key integration at a time (gamification might be a great first step). Finally, thorough testing and refinement after each phase.

This looks like a fascinating project. I'd be really interested in chatting more about the specifics of your integrations and how we might best approach them."

proposals.job_title: Email & Digital Marketing Assistant (Full-Time, Remote)
proposals.description:
We’re looking for a full-time, remote Email & Digital Marketing Assistant to join a fast-growing ecommerce brand in the hair and beauty space. This is a great opportunity for someone with hands-on experience in both email marketing and digital advertising, particularly with Klaviyo, Google Ads, and Google Analytics. 

You’ll work closely with the Head of Marketing to run email campaigns, manage paid ads, and support broader digital marketing efforts across channels. We’re looking for someone pro...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you're looking for someone to jump in and help with email & digital marketing – especially with Klaviyo, Google Ads, and Analytics. The "run email campaigns, manage paid ads" part jumped out at me because I've seen how quickly things can get overwhelming in those platforms without a solid automation backbone.

A few years back, I helped a beauty startup that was bleeding ad spend because their audience segments were a mess. We spent a week just mapping user journeys and automating the segmentation within Klaviyo, and it saved them a small fortune.

I'd approach your needs by:
1. Diving into your current Klaviyo and Google Ads setups to identify quick wins.
2. Setting up automated segmentation based on customer behavior, ad engagement, and product interests.
3. Continuously optimizing based on data from Google Analytics to improve email & ad performance

Would love to chat about the specifics and see if I can bring that same level of clarity and efficiency to your team. Let me know if you're free for a quick call next week.

proposals.job_title: Skilled AI/Python Developer Needed for Innovative Project
proposals.description:
Looking for a skilled AI/Python developer to collaborate on 3–4 AI-driven projects involving technologies like the ChatGPT API and machine learning frameworks. The focus will be on both project execution and architectural understanding.
 
Engagement Details:
1. You will work closely on 3–4 AI-based Python projects
2. Daily sessions are preferred for code walkthroughs, architecture explanations, and implementation 
    support
3. Project scoping and ideation may be partially handled; your role is...
proposals.message:
Okay, I saw you're looking for someone to help "collaborate on 3-4 AI-driven projects" and really understand the architecture, which is key. I've found that AI projects, especially with the ChatGPT API, can quickly become unwieldy if the foundation isn't solid from the start.

A few years back, I jumped into a project where the client hadn’t considered the data pipeline at all, and it ended up doubling the development time just to get decent results.

To avoid that, I'd propose first focusing on solidifying the architectural plan, then building out a prototype within one project to test everything, and finally expanding to the other projects with that shared, strong core. Daily sessions would be perfect for keeping the architecture clean and ensure the projects run smoothly.

Would love to chat more about your ideas and how I could help.

proposals.job_title: AI Chatbot Customer Service Specialist Needed
proposals.description: We are seeking a skilled professional to develop and implement an AI chatbot for our customer service needs. The ideal candidate will possess expertise in creating conversational AI systems that enhance customer interaction and reduce response times. You will be responsible for designing the dialogue flow, integrating with our existing systems, and ensuring a seamless user experience. Strong problem-solving skills and familiarity with AI tools are essential. If you're passionate about improving ...
proposals.message:
Hi there,

Reading about your need for an AI chatbot to improve customer service and reduce response times, I immediately thought about a similar bottleneck I helped a small e-commerce company overcome last year. They were drowning in basic inquiries and, honestly, their support team was getting burned out.

For your project, I'd suggest starting with a deep dive into your current customer service interactions to identify the most common, easily automated queries. Then, we could build a conversational flow focused on those specific pain points, integrating it with your existing systems. Finally, we'd thoroughly test and refine the chatbot based on real-world user feedback.

If you'd like to chat more about how this might work for your specific needs, I'm happy to jump on a quick call.

proposals.job_title: Freelance PHP MySQL Developer Needed for Ongoing Projects
proposals.description:
We are seeking a talented freelance developer to assist with our Bootstrap, jQuery, PHP MySQL application on a recurring basis. The application is built on vanilla PHP, no framework experience needed.  The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in SQL (MariaDB) and a strong track record of delivering high-quality code. 

Typical types of tasks are implementing CRUD functionality following the existing coding standards in our code repo.  Proficiency with PHPMyAdmin is needed to add new ta...
proposals.message:
Hi there,

Reading about needing someone comfortable with vanilla PHP and MySQL for ongoing work implementing CRUD functionalities really resonated with me. I've been there! I remember one project where we inherited a sprawling database schema and spent days just untangling the table relationships before we could even start building.

For your situation, I'd focus first on getting a handle on your existing code repository and coding standards. Then, for each CRUD implementation, I'd start with designing the SQL queries in PHPMyAdmin to ensure they're efficient, before coding them directly into the application. Finally, thorough testing to ensure proper data validation and integration.

Would you be open to a quick chat to discuss the specifics of your application and how I can help?

proposals.job_title: Title: Shopify store developer
proposals.description: We are seeking a skilled Shopify Store Developer to design, develop, and optimize high-converting e-commerce websites. Responsibilities include theme customization, app integration, performance optimization, and responsive design. Must have strong knowledge of Shopify Liquid, HTML/CSS, and SEO best practices. Experience with Shopify Plus is a plus.
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you're looking for someone to "design, develop, and optimize high-converting e-commerce websites" on Shopify. I get it – the optimization part can be a real time-sink. I recently helped a client who was manually updating product inventory; it was eating up hours of their week.

For you, I'd start by auditing your current theme and app setup to see what’s slowing things down. Then, we could tackle app integration to streamline some of those manual processes you mentioned. Finally, I'd focus on optimizing for mobile, as that's where a lot of e-commerce traffic is heading.

Would love to chat more about your specific workflow and how we can make it smoother. Let me know if you're free for a quick call.

proposals.job_title: Email & Digital Marketing Assistant (Full-Time, Remote)

proposals.job_title: Langchain, agentic developer - 5 years + India,  Nigeria, Kenya, Egypt, Bangladesh 3 position

Practical experience with LangChain, LangGraph, RAG pipelines, agent frameworks
Strong knowledge of async workflows, deployment, observability, and performance
This is a software engineering role (not data science, analytics, or annotation

Th...
proposals.message:

proposals.job_title: Make.com intregrations expert
proposals.description:
We are automizing different processes with Make.com

Sources we work with:
- TG messenger  - for giving instructions
- Midjourney to create pictures
- Google Drive to upload
- LLM model as ChatGPT, Gemini, Perplexity to give feedback to pictures
- LLM model to create text / quotes for pictures and for single content
- Create content, upload, put information into google spreadsheet.

We have many chains we want to build and need somebody who can support us with integrations and who has significan...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw your project description mentioning the need to automate processes with Make.com – especially the part about creating content, uploading, and then manually wrangling that info into Google Sheets. I totally get it. I was helping a photographer friend streamline his workflow the other day, and just the Google Drive upload step was eating up half his afternoon!

For your setup, I'd initially focus on connecting TG messenger to Make.com to trigger the image creation in Midjourney. Then, feed that image to your LLM for feedback, and finally automatically upload everything to Drive and update the Google Sheet. We can tackle this in stages to make sure everything's smooth.

I'm available for a quick chat to see how this all comes together. Let me know if you're free sometime this week.

proposals.job_title: Need an Expert Website Builder to Create a Modern, Fully Functional Business Website
proposals.description: We’re looking for an experienced website builder (no-code or low-code acceptable) to help design and develop a fully functional, visually appealing, and user-friendly business website. This will be the online face of our brand, so quality, performance, and UX are key.
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you're aiming for a "fully functional, visually appealing, and user-friendly business website" - nailed it, that's crucial. I get it; the online face *is* everything these days.

Funny enough, just last month, I helped a local bakery finally ditch their paper order forms and move everything online. What they thought would take weeks was up and running within days, and the owner was *thrilled* with the new level of efficiency.

For your project, I'd start by diving deep into understanding your brand and target audience, sketching out a sitemap for optimal UX, and then choosing the right no-code or low-code platform that fits your specific needs.

I'd love to hear more about your brand. Maybe we can hop on a quick call sometime next week to chat about your vision?

proposals.job_title: NET Developer
proposals.description:
Reynolds and Reynolds is currently seeking candidates with prior experience of systems design and development.

REQUIREMENTS:

2+ years prior work experience is required in one or more of the following:

.NET (C# or VB.NET)
Microsoft SQL Server (database design, DBA, stored procedures, OLAP and reporting)
Web services integration using SOAP or REST APIs
Training in C/C++ will be provided but prior experience will be an advantage
Proven track record of the delivery of successful projects
A degree...
proposals.message:
Hey there, Reynolds and Reynolds team,

Seeing you're looking for someone to help with system design and development in .NET definitely caught my eye. I've spent a lot of time automating manual processes, which I noticed as one of your key pain points.

Funny enough, years ago, I wrestled with a similar SQL Server database situation where reports were taking hours to generate. We ended up streamlining the stored procedures and implementing some clever indexing – shaved the time down to minutes!

For your needs, I’d initially look at: 1) Analyzing your current system bottlenecks, 2) Designing optimized .NET solutions with efficient SQL Server interaction, and 3) Integrating Web services to improve processes.

I’d love to chat more about your specific challenges. Let me know if you're free for a quick call sometime next week.

Cheers,
Timothy

proposals.job_title: n8n Workflow Development for Restaurant Automation
proposals.description: We are seeking an experienced freelancer to help us build and optimize an n8n workflow tailored for our restaurant operations. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of automation processes and how to integrate various tools to enhance efficiency. You will be responsible for continuing the development of our existing workflow, ensuring it meets our specific restaurant needs. If you have a background in n8n and a passion for improving business processes through automation, we want t...
proposals.message:
Hi there,

I saw you're looking to continue development of your n8n workflow for restaurant automation and are facing some integration challenges. I've definitely been there! Just last month I spent a week wrestling with a clunky legacy POS system that refused to play nice with a new inventory management tool. It taught me a lot about creative workarounds and the importance of thoroughly testing each integration point.

To help you get back on track, I'd suggest first taking a deep dive into your existing workflow to identify any bottlenecks, then map out a clear integration strategy for each tool based on your restaurant's unique processes, and finally, rigorously test each integration to ensure smooth data flow.

Would love to chat briefly about the specific tools you're working with and see if my experience might be a good fit for your needs.

proposals.job_title: Klaviyo Expert Needed for Audience Segmentation and List Management
proposals.description: We are seeking a Klaviyo expert who can assist us in better segmenting our audience for targeted marketing efforts. The ideal candidate will also provide guidance on maintaining a clean and active email list. Your expertise will help us enhance our email marketing strategy and improve overall engagement. If you have a strong background in Klaviyo and proven results in audience segmentation and list hygiene, we want to hear from you!
proposals.message:
Hey there,

"Better segmenting our audience for targeted marketing efforts" – I get it. Spent a chunk of last year untangling a client’s Klaviyo setup that was basically sending the wrong promotions to the wrong people, and it was a mess! We ended up finding almost half their list was completely miscategorized.

To help you, I'd start by diving into your existing customer data to identify key segments based on purchase history and behavior. Then, we’d refine your current flows to personalize messaging for those segments. Finally, I’d implement a cleanup strategy (potentially using double opt-in for new subscribers) to boost list health.

Would love to chat more about how I can help you get your Klaviyo shipshape!

proposals.job_title: Simple Zapier Automation Help Needed
proposals.description:
I'm looking for zapier automation help regarding my twilio and elevenlabs conversational AI flow. 

I want to get an email notification everytime there's an inbound call to my twilio number.
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you're looking for some Zapier help with Twilio and ElevenLabs – specifically getting an email notification on inbound calls. I totally get that; those little manual tasks can really eat up time.

I remember early on when I was building my own Twilio integration, I spent a *day* debugging a similar email notification setup. Turns out, a simple formatting error was the culprit!

For your project, I'd suggest we first confirm the webhook trigger from Twilio is sending the call data correctly. Then, we'll map those data fields (like the caller ID) to the email template in Zapier, and finally, add a filter to only trigger on inbound calls.

If this approach sounds good, let's hop on a quick call. I can take a look at your current setup and we can walk through this together.

proposals.job_title: Build me a newsletter / blogpost with automation
proposals.description:
I want someone to create me a blog post / newsletter template ( I don’t really know the difference) 
So I have written a blog post I need it to have a button on it to send any subscribers to my CRM, I have 2 Hubspot and mailer lite, either one does it for me.
I then want an automated follow up system which I will need help with, your experience will help me a lot in this.
I will be sending an email to potential opportunities and existing subscribers, but these are from other sites so need to com...
proposals.message:
Hi there,

"I don’t really know the difference," you said about blog posts and newsletters – totally understandable! I actually had a client last year in a similar spot. They thought they needed a full-blown blog, but after chatting, a well-designed newsletter with snippets of blog content worked better for their audience.

For your project, I'd suggest starting with:
1. Crafting that template for either a blog post or newsletter, focusing on a clean design that integrates seamlessly with HubSpot or MailerLite (whichever you prefer).
2. Embedding that call-to-action button to collect those new subscribers.
3. Designing a simple, automated follow-up sequence within your chosen CRM to nurture those leads.

Happy to have a quick chat about your specific content and goals to figure out the best approach. Let me know if you're free sometime next week.

proposals.job_title: Need Canva Expert to integrate created content with custom content platform library.
proposals.description:
We are a marketing and content management platform called Evolved Office. Our platform runs in MVC .NET written in JQuery and C#. We have added AI-Generated image content modules and are expanding the type of content we offer along with new marketing vehicles for our clients. 

In order to bring Canva design closer to our platform, we would like to integrate by creating an application inside the Share application options inside Canva. If possible we would like to utilize SSO (single-sign on for ...
proposals.message:
Hi Evolved Office team,

"Bringing Canva design closer to our platform" – I get it. I've wrestled with similar integrations before, especially with platforms built on the .NET stack. Once, I spent a week chasing a ghost API call because of a subtle mismatch in authentication protocols. Fun times!

To get your Canva integration running smoothly, I'd suggest: first, diving deep into Canva's API documentation, specifically around sharing and SSO options. Then, I'd build a small proof-of-concept app to test the connection and authentication flow. Finally, we can integrate that into your existing MVC .NET architecture and jQuery framework.

Would you be open to a quick chat so I can understand the specifics of your setup and authentication needs?

proposals.job_title: Next.js Developer for Frontend Migration from Flutter
proposals.description:
Project Title:
Migrate Frontend WebApp from Flutter/Dart to Next.js for Travel Web App (travelbud.in)

Project Description:
We are looking for a skilled and experienced Front-End Developer to migrate our existing WebApp frontend built with Flutter (Dart) to Next.js (React framework). Our product is TravelBud (https://travelbud.in) — a travel platform that connects travelers with unique homestay experiences across India.

Goal:
The goal of this project is to create a more scalable, SEO-friendly, ...
proposals.message:
Hey there! Saw you're migrating travelbud.in from Flutter to Next.js – I hear you on the scalability and SEO front with Flutter web apps sometimes.

I actually helped a client a few years back who'd built a real-estate portal in Flutter, and we ended up rewriting the front-end in React for very similar reasons. The biggest thing we focused on was carefully mapping the data flow between the two platforms and establishing a very clear, documented API to make the switch seamless.

For your project, I'd suggest starting with a component-by-component migration strategy. After that, we could use a staging environment to iron out any integration challenges you foresee. Finally, we can optimize the app to meet your desired SEO requirements.

Would love to chat more about your specific setup sometime this week if you're free.

proposals.job_title: FastAPI Developer for RESTful API Development
proposals.description: We are seeking an experienced FastAPI Developer to create robust RESTful APIs using Python. The ideal candidate should be proficient in modern development workflows, including Docker and Git, to ensure seamless collaboration and deployment. Experience with SQLAlchemy or Pydantic is essential for effective data handling and validation. If you have a passion for building efficient APIs and enjoy working in a dynamic environment, we would love to hear from you!
proposals.message:
Okay, here's my Upwork proposal:

Hey there,

Seeing that you're aiming to build efficient APIs to free up time from manual processes immediately caught my eye. I remember back when I first automated a client's inventory system, they were spending *hours* each week just manually updating spreadsheets. Once we integrated the API, it was like a weight lifted.

For your project, I'd start by diving into your specific data structures and workflow to design the API endpoints using FastAPI and Pydantic for robust validation. Then, I'd build out the core logic with SQLAlchemy for database interactions. Finally, I'd containerize it all with Docker for easy deployment.

If you're open to a quick chat about your current manual process and how an API could streamline things, I'm happy to share some initial ideas.

proposals.job_title: Selenium Python Bot Development for Color Change Detection

Hey there,

I saw you're looking for someone to handle color change detection and move away from manual monitoring – I get it! I helped a small e-commerce site a while back that was doing the same thing to track competitor pricing, and it was a total time sink for them. They were basically glued to their screens.

For your project, I'd start by nailing down the specific color detection method on that website, making sure it's super accurate. Then, I'd build the Selenium/Python bot to continuously check and flag those changes. Finally, we'd set up a notification system (email, maybe?) so you're alerted immediately.

If that sounds like a reasonable approach, I'd love to chat more and understand the nuances of the website you're monitoring. Let me know if you're free for a quick call!

Timothy

proposals.job_title: Seeking experienced SEO/GEO specialist for an interview on GEO Market Trends
proposals.description:
We're looking to speak with experienced SEO consultants who:
- Manage SEO for clients
- Are familiar with GEO (Generative Engine Optimization) or AI-driven search
- Have thoughts on how SEO is evolving with the rise of generative AI

We’d like to understand:
- Whether your clients care about AI visibility yet
- Using any GEO tool(s)
- How a GEO tool might fit into your reporting/content workflow
- What you'd expect such a tool to do, and whether you'd use/pay for it
proposals.message:
---

Hey there,

Reading about your search for thoughts on how SEO is evolving with generative AI really hit home. I've been seeing the same thing – clients are slowly starting to ask about "AI visibility," but it's still early days.

A few months back, I had a client in the travel niche who was hyper-focused on ranking for local keywords. We ended up spending *hours* manually optimizing Google Business Profiles. Made me think: wouldn't it be great to automate some of that, to surface key trends more easily?

If we chat, I'd be curious to share some potential content workflow ideas:
1.   How to integrate a GEO tool into reporting.
2.   A brief analysis of a single GEO optimization.
3.   Then, discuss a list of requirements that this should do in the future.

I'd love to brainstorm some ideas with you. Let me know if you're free for a quick call next week!

proposals.job_title: HubSpot Expert Needed for System Architecture and Process Development

proposals.job_title: Expert Needed for ComfyUI & Identity Transfer Workflow Setup
proposals.description:
Need Expert for ComfyUI + InstantID + IP-Adapter + ControlNet Workflow – Realistic Face Identity Transfer Setup

Description:
I’m working on a project that involves realistic identity transfer between two photos for internal testing of image verification systems (e.g., KYC automation, photo-matching reliability, identity consistency checks).

I need someone experienced in ComfyUI, InstantID, IP-Adapter, and ControlNet (Inpaint) to help me set up and execute the following workflow:

Workflow Need...
proposals.message:
Okay, here's my attempt at a believable, personable Upwork proposal:

---

Hey there,

"Manual processes" always scream "opportunity" to me! I totally get the desire to automate image verification – spent a good chunk of last year wrestling with similar identity consistency challenges for a facial recognition system used in secure access control. Learned a *lot* about finetuning these transfer workflows.

For your ComfyUI setup, I’d suggest first tackling the core InstantID + IP-Adapter integration, then layering in ControlNet Inpaint specifically for those tricky areas that need cleaner transitions. Finally, we can test and iterate on that workflow to improve fidelity using the "identity consistency checks" you mentioned.

If you're interested, I'd be happy to jump on a quick call to talk through the specifics of your data and how we can dial in the realism you're looking for. Let me know!
---

proposals.message:
Hey there,

"Seeking an experienced full stack developer to create robust enterprise applications..." and focusing on automating manual processes? I get it. I remember wrestling with a similar problem for a logistics company a few years back. They were drowning in spreadsheets. The turning point was mapping out their data flow visually before writing a single line of code - really helped identify the bottlenecks.

For your project, I’d suggest first diving into your existing workflows to pinpoint the areas that are eating up the most time. Then, we could prioritize those areas for automation and develop custom solutions for them. Finally, thorough testing will be crucial.

Would love to chat more about your specific needs and see if my experience aligns. Let me know if you're free for a quick call sometime this week.

proposals.job_title: Excel Expert Needed for Complex Forecasting & Distribution File Optimisation
proposals.description:
We’re looking for an experienced Excel specialist to help us review, troubleshoot, and optimise a sophisticated forecasting and distribution workbook used in a global enterprise environment.

The Excel file includes a mix of formula-driven logic, dynamic links to external data sources, manual override fields, and macro functionality. It’s used to manage product distribution across multiple retail locations and requires an expert eye to diagnose structural problems and improve performance without...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

"Manual processes" and "automation needs" in a global distribution setup - I feel that pain! I once spent a week wrestling with a similar forecasting model for a national grocery chain. The biggest bottleneck turned out to be a hidden circular reference deep within a lookup table.

For your file, I'd suggest a phased approach: first, a thorough structural audit to identify bottlenecks and inefficiencies using Excel's built-in diagnostic tools. Then, we could focus on streamlining those manual override fields, perhaps with some user-friendly data validation techniques. Finally, we can discuss any macro adjustments or potential integrations to truly automate those repetitive steps.

Would be happy to hop on a quick call and discuss the specifics of your workbook and see if my experience aligns with your needs.

proposals.job_title: Experienced Customer Support Rep (Gorgias + E-commerce) – 30+ hrs/week

This is not just a ticket-responder role—we’re seeking someone who can optimize our support systems, improve workflows, and be a long-term asset to our customer experience department.

⸻

🧠 What You’ll Be Doing:
	•	Responding to customer inquiries via Gorgias (email + potentially live ch...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you're looking for someone who can do more than just answer tickets and help optimize support systems, and that really resonated with me. I’ve spent a good chunk of my time as an automation specialist untangling manual processes for businesses. I remember working with a skincare company struggling to manage inquiries – we streamlined their order tracking responses using a little Gorgias magic, freeing them to focus on, you know, actually *selling* skincare.

For you, I'd suggest starting with a deep dive into your current Gorgias setup, mapping out common inquiry types to pinpoint automation opportunities. Then, we could prioritize building out automated workflows (order status, returns, etc.) based on frequency and impact. Finally, we'd look at integrating data from your e-commerce platform for truly personalized responses.

Happy to chat more about your specific needs and see if my experience aligns. Let me know if you're free for a quick call.

proposals.job_title: Build a Simple Instagram Messaging Bot
proposals.description: We’re looking for a Python developer to build a simple Instagram messaging bot using FastAPI and Meta’s official Graph API. The bot should receive incoming messages via a webhook and respond automatically to predefined messages (e.g., keyword-based replies). This should be a lightweight and clean solution — no scraping, only official API use. The main goal is to automate basic Instagram DM replies and improve follower interaction. The bot must be built using FastAPI, and should include clear ins...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you're looking for a "lightweight and clean" Instagram messaging bot. I get it – nobody wants bloated, scraping-dependent solutions these days.

A few years back, I helped a local bookstore automate their event announcements via DMs. The biggest challenge was nailing the keyword triggers so the bot felt helpful, not spammy. We ended up doing a lot of user testing!

For your project, I'd start by getting the FastAPI webhook set up and authenticated with the Graph API. Then, we’d focus on building out those key message/response pairs, making sure the logic is solid. Finally, I'd deliver it with clear instructions for ongoing maintenance.

I'd love to chat more about the specific keywords and responses you have in mind. Let me know if you're free for a quick call sometime this week?
